titles.ar: كِتَابُ الْأَيْمَانِ وَ النُّذُورِ وَ الْكَفَّارَاتِ
titles.en: THE BOOK OF OATHS, AND THE VOWS, AND THE EXPIATIONS

titles.ar: باب أَنَّهُ لَا يَحْلِفُ الرَّجُلُ إِلَّا عَلَى عِلْمِهِ
titles.en: Chapter 11 – The man must not swear an oath except upon what is in his knowledge

titles.ar: باب أَنَّهُ لَا يَحْلِفُ الرَّجُلُ إِلَّا عَلَى عِلْمِهِ
titles.en: Chapter 11 – The man must not swear an oath except upon what is in his knowledge

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ سَالِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ لَا يَحْلِفُ الرَّجُلُ إِلَّا عَلَى عِلْمِهِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Hisham Bin Salim, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The man must not swear an oath except based upon his knowledge’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ الْمُغِيرَةِ عَنْ خَالِدِ بْنِ أَيْمَنَ الْحَنَّاطِ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ لَا يُسْتَحْلَفُ الرَّجُلُ إِلَّا عَلَى عِلْمِهِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Abdullah Bin Al Mugheira, from Khalid Bin Ayman Al Hannat, from Abu Baseer, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The man must not be made to swear except what is based upon his knowledge’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ سَالِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ لَا يَحْلِفُ الرَّجُلُ إِلَّا عَلَى عِلْمِهِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hisham Bin Salim, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The man must not swear except based upon his knowledge’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ مَرَّارٍ عَنْ يُونُسَ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ لَا يُسْتَحْلَفُ الرَّجُلُ إِلَّا عَلَى عِلْمِهِ وَ لَا يَقَعُ الْيَمِينُ إِلَّا عَلَى الْعِلْمِ اسْتُحْلِفَ أَوْ لَمْ يُسْتَحْلَفْ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ismail Bin Marrar, from Yunus, fro one of his companions, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The man must not be made to swear except based upon his knowledge, and the oath would not take place except upon the knowledge, whether he has been made to swear or not made to swear’.
